definition: strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort

sentences.english: Perhaps, this is the unbending youth from northeast of China.
sentences.chinese: 也許這就是一個北方大男孩的那種倔強吧？

sentences.english: The horse was behaving fractiously and refused to jump.
sentences.chinese: 這匹馬很倔強，拒絕跳越。

sentences.english: Stubborn smiled, said, rarely going at once, to accompany her.
sentences.chinese: 倔強的笑着，說，難得去一次，好好陪她啊。

sentences.english: Marx, with his usual perversity, thought it was both.
sentences.chinese: 馬克思，帶着慣常的倔強，認爲它兩者都是。

sentences.english: The original clean stubborn stubborn pride had worn out by time.
sentences.chinese: 最初的乾淨倔強固執驕傲早被時間磨破。

sentences.english: The headvertisementswaiter was debonair with the guests but firm with the waiters.
sentences.chinese: 領班對來賓溫文有禮，但是對侍者卻很倔強。

sentences.english: The stubborn student finally began to buckle under.
sentences.chinese: 那個倔強的學生最後開始屈從了。

sentences.english: Oh Lord, we spent three decades refusing to accept you.
sentences.chinese: 主啊，我們花了二三十年的時間，倔強地不接受您。

sentences.english: She was a stubborn woman. Whatever happened, she would strive.
sentences.chinese: 她是一個倔強的女子，無論發生什麼，她都會奮鬥。

sentences.english: This was a whole different emotional tone , more peevish but less selfish.
sentences.chinese: 這種心境與以前完全不同，更加的倔強，卻少了自私。

sentences.english: The Wang Er of children regimental regimental commander that Long Cun rolls south is small it is a stubborn and piquant child king.
sentences.chinese: 南滾龍村的兒童團團長王二小是個倔強調皮的孩子王。
在倔強之下，他還是有點驚訝。

sentences.english: My uncle was a hard-nosed army officer who had seen service in two wars.
sentences.chinese: 我叔叔是位嚴格而又倔強的軍醫，他曾身經兩次大戰。

sentences.english: However, young but unyielding heart is more powerful at murdering love than the difference.
sentences.chinese: 其實，比貧富懸殊更能殺死愛情的是年輕而倔強的心。

sentences.english: Matt looked at Hugh and saw the stubbornness in the set of his shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 馬特看着休，從他堅挺的肩膀中看出了他的倔強。

definition: to bear patiently/to endure silently/to forbear
(typically followed by 就[jiu4]) apt to (lose one's temper, catch a cold etc)/at the drop of a hat
to sever all relations with sb/determined/decisive
spacious and well-lit/open and clear/(of character) optimistic/cheerful/carefree
confident and at ease/free and easy
